analyzed: ral pa'i thor gtshug _sgril nas dkris shing bcings pa/_'od zer dmar po
translated: light-radiating garment.🔽He is extremely terrifying, with bared fangs, and has ten

translated: This is the mantra for summoning.🔽The mantra for recitation is om agha hum svaha. The number of recitations is one hundred or one thousand.

original: 'am stong bzlas nas/_las sbyor brgya brjod par bya'o/_/til nag pos las gang
analyzed: 'am stong bzlas nas/_las sbyor brgya brjod par bya'o/_/til nag pos las gang
translated: Having recited the mantra one hundred times, one should perform the rite as desired.

analyzed: 'dod pa bya'o/_/de ltar bsgrubs pa'i sngags pa de thams cad kyis mthong na
translated: If all those who have accomplished the mantra are seen,

translated: they will be delighted and pleasing. The king will make great offerings🔽and hold them in high regard. All enemies will be bound,

original: btab pa ltar 'gyur ro/_/bgegs thams cad 'byer zhing drung du 'ong mi nus
analyzed: btab pa ltar 'gyur ro/_/bgegs thams cad 'byer zhing drung du 'ong mi nus
translated: like salt dissolving in water. All obstructors will disperse and be unable to approach.

original: par 'gyur ro/_/las thams cad 'grub cing nor rnams brnyed par 'gyur ro/_/
analyzed: par 'gyur ro/_/las thams cad 'grub cing nor rnams brnyed par 'gyur ro/_/
translated: All activities will be accomplished and wealth will be obtained.🔽Whatever is said will be trusted by others.

original: ji skad smras pa'i tshhig la gzhan yid ches par 'gyur ro/_/bgegs sel ba'i
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i tshhig la gzhan yid ches par 'gyur ro/_/bgegs sel ba'i

original: sgrub thabs/_slob dpon di pam ka ras mdzad pa rdzogs snyo//_//
analyzed: sgrub thabs/_slob dpon di pam ka ras mdzad pa rdzogs snyo//_//
translated: The Sadhana, composed by Master Dipamkara, is complete.

original: /_/la chu rgyu ko ba ka _dang __/ yi dam ga_bas_ ga_ _ nga dang lnga 'o_/_/
analyzed: /_/la chu rgyu ko ba ka _dang __/ yi dam ga_bas_ ga_ _ nga dang lnga 'o_/_/
translated: The Five: The Sadhana of the Five Deities of Cakrasaṃvara, the Sadhana of the Five Deities of Hevajra, the Sadhana of the Five Deities of Mahāmāya, the Sadhana of the Five Deities of Vajrabhairava, and the Sadhana of the Five Deities of Guhyasamaja.
